intro: Jatropha palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's blistering weed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. Jatropha palmeri is known for its toxic properties, with all parts of the plant containing harmful compounds.
